====================================

### National Feasibility Study for Flood Hazard Modeling and Mapping at a Regional Scale

#### Call for Proposals (RFP) Notice

### Overview

The Government of Canada, through Natural Resources Canada (NRCan), is seeking proposals from qualified bidders to conduct a national feasibility study for flood hazard modeling and mapping at a regional scale.

### Purpose

The study aims to:

* Review regional flood hazard modeling examples from Canada and internationally to identify good practices, challenges, and limitations.
* Develop technical recommendations and guidance for regional flood hazard modeling in Canada.
* Develop a research and action plan for NRCan to support federal, provincial, and territorial governments in implementing regional flood hazard modeling through the Flood Hazard Identification and Mapping in Canada (FHIMP) initiative.
* Prepare case studies to evaluate and document the applicability of the proposed technical recommendations and guidance.

### Emphasis on Sustainability and Environment

This study prioritizes environmental management, as per the UNSPSC code 77100000. The successful bidder will demonstrate expertise in sustaining environmental equilibrium.
